title: Dimensional Analysis & SI/USCS
objectives: Use dimensional analysis (factor–label method) to convert units.
Recall SI base units, common derived units, and metric prefixes.
Convert between SI and USCS; cube/square conversion factors correctly.
Handle density and pressure conversions common on the FE Chemical.

sections.heading: 1) What is dimensional analysis?
body: Dimensional analysis treats units like algebraic symbols. Conversion factors are ratios equal to 1 (e.g., 1 in = 2.54 cm gives 1 = 2.54 cm / 1 in).
Multiply by conversion factors so that unwanted units cancel, leaving the desired unit.
Always carry units in every step; if units don’t cancel to the target, the setup is wrong.

sections.heading: 2) SI base & derived units (refresher)
body: Base units used most in FE Chem: meter (m), kilogram (kg), second (s), mole (mol), kelvin (K), ampere (A).
Common derived: Newton (N = kg·m/s^2), Pascal (Pa = N/m^2 = kg/(m·s^2)), Joule (J = N·m = kg·m^2/s^2), Watt (W = J/s).
Prefixes to remember: milli (m, 10^-3), micro (µ, 10^-6), kilo (k, 10^3), mega (M, 10^6). Move the decimal by powers of 10.

sections.heading: 3) USCS basics & popular conversions
body: Length: 1 ft = 12 in, 1 in = 2.54 cm (exact), 1 ft = 0.3048 m (exact).

sections.heading: 4) Reliable conversion strategy
body: Write the given quantity as a fraction and multiply by conversion factors so unwanted units cancel.
For squared/cubed units, square/cube the factor AND the unit (e.g., (0.3048 m/ft)^3).
Keep 3–4 sig figs on intermediate steps; round at the end.
Sanity check: Is the answer magnitude reasonable?

sections.heading: 5) Density & pressure reminders
body: Density ρ has units of mass/volume (e.g., kg/m^3, lbm/ft^3). Water near room temperature is about 1000 kg/m^3 ≈ 62.4 lbm/ft^3.
Pressure P = Force/Area. Conversions: 1 atm = 101.325 kPa = 14.696 psi = 760 mmHg.

sections.heading: 6) Dimensional homogeneity
body: Every term in a physically meaningful equation must have the same dimensions (e.g., all terms of energy).
Use unit checking to spot algebra mistakes before plugging numbers.

sections.heading: 7) Pitfalls
body: For volumetric conversions between ft^3 and m^3, don’t forget to cube the length factor.
Do not mix mass (lbm) and force (lbf) inadvertently; convert to SI when in doubt.

quiz.question: Convert 5.00 km to miles. (1 mi = 1.60934 km)
Convert 72.0 in to meters. (1 in = 0.0254 m)
Water density 1000 kg/m^3 equals approximately what in lbm/ft^3?
Convert 1.00 atm to kPa.
Which is the SI unit of force?
Convert 2.50 ft^3 to m^3. (1 ft = 0.3048 m)
Convert 3.00 gal (US) to liters. (1 gal = 3.785411784 L)
Which prefix equals 10^−6?
Convert 250 kPa to psi. (1 psi = 6.894757 kPa)
quiz.explanation: 250 / 6.894757 = 36.26? Wait → 250/6.894757 = 36.26 actually. Correct choice should be 36.3 psi.

quiz.question: Dimensional check: The term (kg·m^2/s^2) corresponds to which unit?
quiz.explanation: kg·m^2/s^2 is Joule (energy). N = kg·m/s^2, Pa = N/m^2, W = J/s.

quiz.question: Convert 0.250 m^3 to ft^3.
Which equality is exact (defined), not measured?
quiz.explanation: By definition 1 in = 2.54 cm exactly; others are rounded.

quiz.question: Convert 24.0 m/s to mi/h.
Which base unit is used for amount of substance?
quiz.explanation: Amount of substance is the mole (mol).

quiz.question: Convert 0.85 g/cm^3 to kg/m^3.
Convert 120 kPa to mmHg. (1 atm = 101.325 kPa = 760 mmHg)
Which is a derived SI unit?
quiz.explanation: N (newton) is derived; m, s, kg are base units.

quiz.question: Convert 15.0 lbf/in^2 to kPa. (1 psi = 6.894757 kPa)
Dimensional check: density has which dimensions?
Convert 2.00 ft to cm. (1 in = 2.54 cm)
quiz.explanation: 2 ft = 24 in; 24 × 2.54 = 60.96 cm? Wait: 2 ft = 24 in is wrong; 2 ft = 24 in? No, 1 ft=12 in, so 2 ft=24 in yes → 60.96 cm → 61.0 cm; correct closest is 61.0 but option D 101.6 is for 40 in. This needs correction: use 4.00 ft instead. If 4 ft: 48 in × 2.54 = 121.92 cm → 122 cm. To keep consistency, take 2.00 *meters*? For clarity, choose 2.00 feet to *inches* to *cm* => 60.96 cm which matches none. Replace options: [A. 60.96, B. 61.0, C. 50.8, D. 101.6] with answer B.
quiz.choices_fix: Use options [A 60.96, B 61.0, C 50.8, D 101.6] and correct answer B.
